review_text:
Great new place to stay in Ruston. This place is safe, quiet, and very clean.
The place is called a dog trot. I will not call it quaint or rustic; I call it historic and a style from by gone days.
The building is separate from any other building. The owners live across the drive about 200 feet away. Easy to get in touch with if you have any questions or problems. But far enough away for privacy.
While it is on the outskirts of Ruston, it is within 2 minutes of a gas station/ convenience store. Just past the station is a great donut shop and a Dollar store. You do not have to go into Ruston if you don’t want to.
If you are there for a Ruston event, it is located about 5 minutes the other way and it is an easy drive into town.
Back to the dog trot. The building’s exterior appears to be original construction. It has a front and back porch with decent views. While you are facing the owners house, the view to the left overlooks a nice pasture with the possibility of seeing deer. The back porch faces a wooded area and you can see some houses in the distance . The houses are far enough away not to be a noise or privacy issue. The interior is updated but retains realistic construction of the original house. Wooden floors and ceiling in the bedroom and the room across the dog trot breeze way. The bathroom has wood styled linoleum floor with original walls. But the fixtures are modern the tub and shower got me in trouble with my wife. (I am going to have to get a shower like the dog trot.) The bathroom is bigger and better than most hotels we have stayed at.
There is also a walking trail on the property if you are so inclined.
Even more important is that the property is private and will not have the general traffic of a hotel. The area is very safe and secure. (If Covid is a concern for you, this is an ideal place.)
Sharon, one of the owners met us on arrival and showed us everything about the property. She was very friendly and helpful.
Personally, my wife and I live in the country with only one neighbor. This place is just as quiet. If you are looking for a quiet, clean, convenient place to stay in Ruston this is it.
We have 3 grandsons attending La. Tech so we are frequent visitors to Ruston. This is our new and favorite place to stay.
